greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Exponent of A046021(n) (least inverse of Kempner function A002034) when written as a power of A006530(n) (largest prime dividing n), with a(1) = 1.
reference: R. L. Graham, D. E. Knuth and O. Patashnik, Factorial Factors, Section 4.4 in Concrete Mathematics, 2nd ed. Reading, MA: Addison-Wesley, pp. 111-115, 1994.
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Greatest Prime Factor
Index entries for sequences related to factorial numbers.
formula: a(n) = 1 + Sum_{k=1..floor(log(n-1)/log(P))} floor((n-1)/P^k) for n > 1, where P = A006530(n) is the greatest prime factor of n.
results.author: _Jonathan Sondow_, Dec 26 2004
